intro: Thalictrum sphaerocarpum subsp. udum, commonly known as the narrowleaf meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is known for its subtle fragrance. It produces distinctive, berry-like fruits that mature in late summer, contributing to its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
